alert.note: Alert for Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 11 at 7:45PM MST until December 12 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...West winds 15 to 30 mph with localized gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...The Northern Front Range Foothills, The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks and Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range. * WHEN...Until noon MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Strong winds will blow unsecured objects around. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Travel will be difficult for high profile vehicles. Areas of blowing snow will be likely over high mountain passes and roadways.
info.instruction: Strong winds may lead to property damage. Hazardous driving conditions due to powerful cross winds will pose a serious risk for drivers, especially for light weight and high profile vehicles. Loose outdoor items should be brought inside or secured properly.
